title: Business & Finance
text:
Microsoft agreed to buy artificial-intelligence company Nuance Communications for $16 billion, extending CEO Nadella's run of big acquisitions.

---

The U.K. government announced an independent review into contracts it handed Greensill and the role played by ex-Prime Minister Cameron in lobbying on the firm's behalf.

---

Uber Technologies reported record monthly bookings for March as Covid-19 vaccination rates accelerated across the U.S.

---

Some SPACs have improperly accounted for warrants sold or given to investors, the SEC said, stepping up scrutiny of the popular vehicles.

---

GameStop is looking to replace CEO Sherman in an effort being led by Chewy co-founder Cohen, who became a director in January.

---

Nvidia is increasing the competitive pressure on Intel with plans to start selling central-processing units to serve the booming data-center market.

---

U.S. stocks edged lower, with the Dow and Nasdaq losing 0.2% and 0.4%, respectively, and the S&P 500 slipping 0.81 point.

---

France's Veolia reached a $15.5 billion deal to acquire Suez, creating a water and waste-management giant.
